title: France's demographics debate focuses on birth rates while ignoring touchier measures
subhead: Politicians have struggled to address the various aspects of France's current demographic shift. The debate on the issue remains focused on boosting birth rates, while steering clear of more sensitive topics such as immigration or the retirement age.

title: Trump tells Israel's Netanyahu Iran talks must continue, says 'nothing definitive reached' at White House meeting
In East Jerusalem, 'The Israelis are advancing everywhere at once, they are suffocating us because there is no longer any international pressure'
'The Washington Post became the collateral damage ofJeff Bezos's choice to forge the strongest possible ties with Trump'
subhead: In his column, Le Monde editorialist Gilles Paris draws a parallel between the opposing choices of two media owners: Jimmy Lai, the pro-democracy resistance figure in Hong Kong, and Jeff Bezos, the owner of the Washington Post.

title: James Van Der Beek, star of 'Dawson's Creek' and father of six, dies at 48
subhead: The TV star, who announced his colorectal cancer diagnosis in 2024, 'met his final days with courage, faith and grace,' a post on his Instagram read. 'For now we ask for peaceful privacy as we grieve our loving husband, father, son, brother, and friend.'

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: France's Cizeron and Fournier Beaudry snatch ice dancing gold
subhead: Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry concluded their competition with a mesmerizing routine set to the powerful soundtrack of the 2022 film 'The Whale.' They finished 1.43 points ahead of the USA's three-time world champions Madison Chock and Evan Bates.

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhead: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

Macron's failed bet to achieve full employment by 2027
subhead: The French president set a goal of reducing the unemployment rate to 5% by the end of his second term. That target has become unattainable according to figures from the national statistics office published on Tuesday, which show a 0.6-point increase over the past year, reaching 7.9%.

title: How the Epstein scandal brought down Jack Lang
subhead: The emblematic minister from President François Mitterrand's era was forced to step down as president of the Arab World Institute in Paris. Former allies and rivals have begun to speak out about a man who used his influence and network to maintain a lavish lifestyle.

title: Paris trial shines light on everyday cybercrime as couple faces ransomware charges
subhead: Two Russian nationals stand trial in Paris in a case emblematic of the wave of ransomware attacks that France has seen for more than six years.
